snippet: Hospital authorities insisted that there had been no threat to the safety of Malala Yousafzai, who was spirited out of Pakistan out of fear that the Taliban might try again to shoot her.
abstract: British police say that they questioned and turned away two people who tried to visit Malala Yousafzai in the British hospital where the 14-year-old Pakistani schoolgirl is being treated after being shot by the Taliban.

byline.original: By ALAN COWELL and CHRISTINE HAUSER
byline.contributor: Alan Cowell reported from London, and Christine Hauser from New York. Declan Walsh contributed reporting from Islamabad, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: Hospital authorities insisted that there had been no threat to the safety of Malala Yousafzai, who was spirited out of Pakistan out of fear that the Taliban might try again to shoot her.

headline.seo: British Police Stop ‘Well-Wishers’ in Pakistani Girl’s Hospital
headline.main: British Police Stop ‘Well-Wishers’ in Pakistani Girl’s Hospital
headline.print_headline:
Britain: Visitors Are Turned Away,
But Are No Threat to Pakistani Girl
